images.alt: A demonstration of where you can find the drafts feature in the top right corner of the post composer on Bluesky.

record.text:
v1.116 is rolling out now!

For all the overthinkers and perfectionists out there, we're launching Drafts.

images.alt: A demonstration of where you can find the drafts feature in the top right corner of the post composer on Bluesky.

record.text: On the flipside, the sneaky new autoplay-with-sound has never been a good idea in the entire history of ideas, and it's disappointing to see that the only way to opt out of that is by disabling autoplay altogether.
FINALLY
I will begin drafting hundreds of posts with dog pictures immediately
WE NEED IMAGES IN DM‚Äôs PLEASE THIS APP WOULD BE SO MUCH MORE ALIVE

please make an optional delayed posting

15-second countdown timer like gmail

a way to store posts before you send them

Great! How do I access this?
The "drafts" button will appear as soon as you update your app to the latest version. (On mobile you can visit the app store and search for Bluesky, and on desktop/web, you just need to refresh.)
I'm on version: 1.116.0 but no drafts button. How do I refresh? (Tried close/re-open.)

Ah, I should have said that it's part of the process of creating a post‚Äîso when you tap the blue button to create a post and start typing, you should see the word "Drafts" at the top of the window, which you can click to save your draft rather than posting it

in the bluesky app > settings > about

When you hit cancel on a post you will get the option to save a draft.

Say you need to go find a citation or you want to be able to refine your thoughts later on something.

Or, you have an immediate knee-jerk reaction to something that should never see the light of day, but you want to remember it

I believe "editing" in any kind right now is just deleting the old record and making a new one that has the same ID

so it's just a copy post content, delete and make new post üôÉ
Wonderful point you make!
üôÑ

Deleting a comment sometimes makes the entire list you're commenting on vanish. Trying to find it again is a pain. 

Edit within a minute is perfectly reasonable
basically, yes. comments will stay as far as I remember, but all the other metrics break, as they store a cryptographic hash of the post to prevent altering

Then what we need is what looks like an EDIT button to the user, but what it does is replaces the pointer to the content of the post. This way people can FIX THEIR SPELLING AND GRAMMAR MISTAKES without the post losing steam. I assume anyway as I never make sucj mistakes.

yea you basically orphan everything üò≠üò≠

sure digitally signing everything is great in a trust less eco system but that means you're lacking the social features of a social network app lol
So an edit basically would then be a delete the old post then making a new post (all done in the background) but keeping the post ID an I correct?

update the pointer(|s) to the new hash,
provide a link to the old hash..  similar to editing on Wikipedia
en.wikipedia.org/w/index.php?...
I wonder if post edition is technically possible on atproto with the ability to keep the same ID

it does keep the ID but it still breaks the digital signatures of other records since you modified the content 

bsky.app/profile/leno...

record.text: üíØ

it kinda should, no? just because you agreed with an old version of a post doesn't mean the same for the current version

maybe some kind of heuristic based on how much the post changed might make sense, not sure
people would just be like "oh wtf why are all likes gone" etc
yeah, it's not great UX...

I think the old post should still exist as a history record attached to the new one, with all the engagement of the original still attached to the old one, each subsequent edit would add more history records (Like commits in GIT for devs).

But I agree changing "didnt" to "didn't" shouldn't reset engagement, while swapping out the name of a place/person should.

"I love Perth, UK" vs "I love Perth, AU" is at best a 2 letter difference, and over 300 characters that is a tiny change, but they are on opposite sides of the world...
I didnt knowüíî
metics

The question you need to answer is, what about things that got shared?

e.g. have an edit time window in which the post can't be shared, or notifications for anyone who shared the post, to inform them of the new version etc.

Otherwise you'll have "funny viral joke turning into spam" ALL the time.

external.description:
Skyscraper is the Bluesky client that feels like it belongs on your device.

Built from the ground up for iOS and iPadOS, Skyscraper is your penthouse view of the Bluesky network. Smooth, fast, and thoughtfully designed to match the way you want an app to feel. 

The Features You Need:
‚Ä¢ Full timeline with pinned feeds and custom algorithms
‚Ä¢ Post with images, videos, GIFs, and alt text
‚Ä¢ Direct messages and notifications with optional push alerts
‚Ä¢ Search posts, users, and hashtags
‚Ä¢ Moderation controls that put you in charge
‚Ä¢ Profile editing and saved posts

Power features that set Skyscraper apart:
‚Ä¢ Multiple Accounts ‚Äî Switch between accounts instantly
‚Ä¢ Post Drafts ‚Äî Save ideas for later
‚Ä¢ Account Backup ‚Äî Export and archive your data
‚Ä¢ Thread Archival - Share popular threads with friends off Bluesky
‚Ä¢ Safari Extension ‚Äî Open bsky.social links directly in Skyscraper
‚Ä¢ Trending Hashtags ‚Äî See what's buzzing right now
‚Ä¢ Unified Timeline ‚Äî See replies in your following feed
‚Ä¢ Mute Reposts ‚Äî Silence repost-happy users without unfollowing
‚Ä¢ Custom Theme Colors ‚Äî Make the app fit your personality
‚Ä¢ Post Translation ‚Äî Read posts in any language

Download Skyscraper and get a better view of the Bluesky.

EULA - https://www.apple.com/legal/internet-services/itunes/dev/stdeula/
external.title: Skyscraper for Bluesky

images.alt:
bnewbold commented last week ‚Ä¢ edited -

I'm not on the product team, so I can't give an authoritative answer here, but I can share my take/perspective on images in DMs. TL;DR it isn't going to be very satisfying

The hard part of any non-public media sharing is likely going to be moderation and privacy: who has administrative access to the media files, and what the policies are for looking at them. Images in DMs will absolutely be used for nudes from day zero, and also absolutely used for harassment and illegal abuse content.
The stakes for operational security and leaks will be high.

We're going to need to bite all that off at some point, but it is going to to take time. We are just starting to work on the design for "permissioned data" at the protocol level, and policies will probably start coming together as that wraps up. I'm not sure what that will mean specifically for images in DMs.

For now i'd recommend using bsky DMs to set up alternative channels (like discord or signal), though we know this isn't a very satisfying answer. There is strong interest in media in DMs (and also group DMs), and it feels pretty inevitable that there will be a smooth UX for that before too long.

On the other hand, Sophie looks like a great cat.

4 üëç reactions

how will you monetize and when?

every other VC funded company has fucked its users when they eventually provide a ROI to investors. and while decentralization is a bit of a hedge, Google demonstrates that even while operating on the open web, they were able to abuse their position by being the king of search. with the way that #ATproto works where the best results will probably come from everybody using the same app view, are you trying to be the Google of social media?

record.text: Thank you!!
Out of curiosity is this part of Bsky App or Atproto?
Group DMs and images in DMs?
top request: ability to batch-renew all muted terms/tags, rather than having to retype and delete the old ones piling up one by one!
Hi, Paula! OK, I can't resist asking: Why would you rather batch-renew all your muted terms regularly rather than just muting them all indefinitely (while reserving the right to unmute whenever)?

Often I just want to take a periodic break from All The Terrible News. So I‚Äôll do a round of terms muted for a 7 day period or 30 day period, which typically slows the huge flow of chaos (like Epstein/pedophile news). But every time I need another brief break I have to retype in every single one.
I want to stay informed, but it‚Äôs easy to get overwhelmed as a topic takes over for a news cycle.
As it stands you can‚Äôt even hit ‚Äúrenew‚Äù on a single term you‚Äôve already typed in.

I would like to extend this and have terms separated into lists, so I can set a list to indefinite mute, or for a period of time with the ability to reset the mute period after it expires.

Have my political terms list (etc) and mute it for a week or whatever.
Yes! Being able to renew a word I muted in the past would be awesome
Ah, fair! That's such an interesting use case. I like it.
I‚Äôve been wanting a periodic break too, so thank you for this solution!

hopping onto this, another use case is to avoid spoilers on upcoming games/shows/movies that have multiple entries, e.g. I always mute pokemon spoilers when a new game comes out and then unmute when I've finished, but I then have to retype all the variations of the tags when a new one is coming out
OMG FINALLY!!
Hurrah!
